dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, earnings season, right? It's kicking off big time this week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, earnings season, right? It's kicking off big time this week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Big banks and airlinestwo of the coronavirus pandemic's worst-hit industrieskick off earnings season on Tuesday, with JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup and Delta Air Lines all set to report before the opening bell.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and like, it's pretty wild because it's two of the industries, uh, hit hardest by the pandemic: big banks and airlines. They're all reporting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and like, it's pretty wild because it's two of the industries, uh, hit hardest by the pandemic: big banks and airlines. They're all reporting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Big banks and airlinestwo of the coronavirus pandemic's worst-hit industrieskick off earnings season on Tuesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, JPMorgan, Citi, American Airlines, all before the bell today. And Goldman Sachs, they're not exactly, like, painting a rosy picture.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, J P Morgan, Citi, American Airlines, all before the bell today. And Goldman Sachs, they're not exactly, like, painting a rosy picture.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among firms reporting Tuesday are Delta Air Lines, JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, BlackRock and Johnson & Johnsonall before the opening bell.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all. They're expecting, uh, weak and uneven sales, and, like, a total collapse in profit margins for the third quarter. Brutal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all. They're expecting, uh, weak and uneven sales, and, like, a total collapse in profit margins for the third quarter. Brutal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Expect weak and uneven sales growth, and a collapse in profit margins, to characterize third-quarter results, Goldman Sachs said in a weekend note to clients...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But they did say, um, that the election results will probably impact stocks more than earnings, which is interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they did say, um, that the election results will probably impact stocks more than earnings, which is interesting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...it still expects election results will have more of an impact on stocks than earnings...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally. And ultimately, they're saying vaccination is, like, essential for the economy to really normalize, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally. And ultimately, they're saying vaccination is, like, essential for the economy to really normalize, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and that ultimately, vaccination is essential for the normalization of the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. They're actually giving it pretty good odds, like a 48% chance of enough doses for 25 million Americans by Q2 or Q3 next year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. They're actually giving it pretty good odds, like a forty eight percent chance of enough doses for twenty five million Americans by Q two or Q three next year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Goldman believes theres a 48% chance that there will be enough doses of an FDA-approved coronavirus vaccine to treat 25 million Americans by the second or third quarters...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's, that's actually better than I thought.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's, that's actually better than I thought.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] I know, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, though, Glenmede, they're saying we've regained 77% of lost economic activity, but earnings? Only a small rebound from, like, an abysmal Q2.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, though, Glenmede, they're saying we've regained seventy seven percent of lost economic activity, but earnings? Only a small rebound from, like, an abysmal Q two.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, wealth management firm Glenmede said Monday that although it estimates 77% of economic activity lost due to social-distancing mandates has been regained, it only expects earnings will see a small rebound from an abysmal second quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they don't expect new highs until the second half of 2021, which, um, not coincidentally, aligns with vaccine delivery estimates.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they don't expect new highs until the second half of twenty twenty one, which, um, not coincidentally, aligns with vaccine delivery estimates.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Glenmede doesnt expect earnings will reach new highs until the second half of 2021, which the firm adds is not so coincidentally aligned with estimates for vaccine delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: LPL Financial kinda echoed that too, saying we might be only a year away from normalized earnings because of, like, efficiencies and vaccine progress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: L P L Financial kinda echoed that too, saying we might be only a year away from normalized earnings because of, like, efficiencies and vaccine progress.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a Monday note to clients, LPL Financial had similar hopes, saying, The combination of efficiencies gained during the recession, the strong performance of the winners and the tremendous progress in Covid-19 treatment and vaccine development, all suggest we may be only a year away from reaching normalized earnings...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a huge theme. But, um, looking at the stock market this year, who's been crushing it? Tech, consumer discretionary, communications.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a huge theme. But, um, looking at the stock market this year, who's been crushing it? Tech, consumer discretionary, communications.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best-performing sectors this year, as tracked by S&P 500 ETFs through Fridays close, include technology (up 32%), consumer discretionary (up 23%) and communications (up 13%).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And who's, uh, really suffered? Energy, down 36%, and financials, down 16%. Poor JPMorgan, their shares have just plummeted, like, 40% this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And who's, uh, really suffered? Energy, down thirty six percent, and financials, down sixteen percent. Poor J P Morgan, their shares have just plummeted, like, forty percent this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: JPMorgan, the nations biggest bank, led by Jamie Dimon, reports tomorrow and has seen shares plummet nearly 28% this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. And the big picture? Goldman expects S&P 500 earnings per share to fall, uh, 21% this quarter. That's a lot, though better than the 32% in Q2.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof. And the big picture? Goldman expects S and P five hundred earnings per share to fall, uh, twenty one percent this quarter. That's a lot, though better than the thirty two percent in Q two.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats how much Goldman said it expects third-quarter earnings per share will fall among S&P 500 firms, compared to a 32% drop in the second quarter and a 15% fall in the first.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And, you know, the economy's recovery has been remarkable since spring, but we're definitely not out of the woods yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And, you know, the economy's recovery has been remarkable since spring, but we're definitely not out of the woods yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In many respects, the economys recovery since this spring has been pretty remarkable. . . . Consumers are driving the pandemic recovery, but the U.S. economy is not completely out of the woods yet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And, um, more fiscal stimulus could really help smooth that path to full recovery once a vaccine is widely available.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And, um, more fiscal stimulus could really help smooth that path to full recovery once a vaccine is widely available.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...an additional round of fiscal stimulus could put the U.S. economy on a gentler and less painful path toward full recovery once a vaccine becomes widely available.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what are you watching for specifically this week?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what are you watching for specifically this week?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Bank of America said banks dominate this week's reports. Delta, JPMorgan, Citi, BlackRock today. Then BofA, Wells Fargo tomorrow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Bank of America said banks dominate this week's reports. Delta, J P Morgan, Citi, BlackRock today. Then B of A, Wells Fargo tomorrow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Banks dominate the 12% of S&P 500 earnings due to be reported this week, Bank of America noted in a Monday research note. Among firms reporting Tuesday are Delta Air Lines, JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, BlackRock and Johnson & Johnsonall before the opening bell. Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Progressive and United Airlines are slated to release earnings on Wednesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Marc Chaikin, he says any positive signs from JPMorgan and Citi today will, um, really help bank stocks and the overall market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Marc Chaikin, he says any positive signs from J P Morgan and Citi today will, um, really help bank stocks and the overall market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Any signs on Tuesday from JPMorgan and Citi that the economy is on the mend will help bank stocks and the overall market, says Marc Chaikin, founder of Philadelphia-based quant investment research firm Chaikin Analytics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. So, uh, lots to unpack as earnings season gets going.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. So, uh, lots to unpack as earnings season gets going.
